methods.makeContext:
Creates a SortKernel for the given chunkType.

:param chunkType: (io.deephaven.engine.chunk.ChunkType) - the type of chunk we are sorting
:param order: (io.deephaven.engine.tables.SortingOrder) - whether we should sort in an ascending or descending direction
:param size: (int) - how many values we will be sorting
:param preserveValues: (boolean) - if the output chunk of our sort should contain the values in sorted order; otherwise the
                       kernel need only permute the input indices into sorted order
:return: (io.deephaven.engine.v2.sort.LongSortKernel<ATTR,KEY_INDICES>) a SortKernel suitable for the given type, order, and size
methods.sort:
**Incompatible overloads text - text from the first overload:**

Sort the values in valuesToSort permuting the indexKeys chunk in the same way.

*Overload 1*  
  :param indexKeys: io.deephaven.engine.chunk.WritableLongChunk<LongSortKernel.KEY_INDICES>
  :param valuesToSort: io.deephaven.engine.chunk.WritableChunk<LongSortKernel.ATTR>
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param indexKeys: io.deephaven.engine.chunk.WritableLongChunk<LongSortKernel.KEY_INDICES>
  :param valuesToSort: io.deephaven.engine.chunk.WritableChunk<LongSortKernel.ATTR>
  :param offsetsIn: io.deephaven.engine.chunk.IntChunk<? extendsio.deephaven.engine.chunk.Attributes.ChunkPositions>
  :param lengthsIn: io.deephaven.engine.chunk.IntChunk<? extendsio.deephaven.engine.chunk.Attributes.ChunkLengths>

text: The SortKernel sorts a chunk of primitive value together with a parallel LongChunk of RowKeys.
